text: Taiwan hijacker seeks political asylum in China. BEIJING 1997-03-10 A jobless Taiwan journalist who hijacked a Taiwanese airliner to China on Monday has requested political asylum, an airport official said. "The hijacker wants political asylum, "the official told Reuters. The official said China's response to the request was not yet known. The suspected hijacker, identified by Taiwan as Liu Shan-chung, was taken into custody and questioned by Chinese police after the Taiwan airliner landed at an airport in the southeastern city of Xiamen. The Boeing 757 operated by the Taiwan airline Far East Air Transport was on a scheduled flight from the island's southern city of Kaohsiung to Taipei when it changed course and headed for the Chinese mainland.
title: CHINA : Taiwan hijacker seeks political asylum in China.
